website_summaries.verdict: These tongs are a good choice if you need a set of tongs you can operate with one hand.
pros: Includes a spring handle and 3 tongs to get a good hold on a piece of wood
Able to pick up heavy logs
Rubberized handle to help protect your hands from hot metal
cons: The handle on this large set of tongs may be a little difficult for people with smaller hands to use

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY!!  Instead get the original PyroClaw 36" Pyroclaw Ultimate Log Grabber
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality & craftsmanship !! Sharp edge underneath handle where trigger is due to bad milling process & no quality control. Also, third arm is very thin 1/8” metal & has a lot of slop/play in travel & at rest. It’s a third of the price of the original 36" Pyroclaw Ultimate Campfire/Fireplace Tool, Log Grabber, Very Heavy Duty, which is "BUILT TO LAST & MADE IN THE USA”. But that’s par for the course from a cheap Chinese knockoff.
customer_reviews.author: Datalyss

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered similar products in the past and have been very satisfied which led me to purchase this product when I built a new fire pit at my new house. The quality of this product is nowhere near the ones I’ve had in the past. The movable third Claw is made of flimsy metal that easily gets bent with average sized logs. It almost seems to be made of aluminum. The other two claws are solid steel and work fine but the third one is the most important and often will drop logs requiring constant straightening out. Do not waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bissett

customer_reviews.title: Very poor craftsmanship and bad design
customer_reviews.text: Very functional when grabbing larger fire wood. The claw however cannot grab on smaller ones. I used it only 4 times and broke at the weld point on the grab handle. Very poor craftsmanship and bad design.
customer_reviews.author: domingo rubinos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: product is very sturdy and works well. will pick up heavy logs. we use it often while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Theiler

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, horrible execution and quality.
customer_reviews.text: The handle was welded poorly and broke off. You can still actuate the gripping mechanism like a "trigger" but I'll be modifying this thing to restore basic functionality. It lasted exactly one day camping before the wire handle snapped off at the weld.
customer_reviews.author: Casey J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as four years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of this product as a replacement for my old one and for gifts. I'm not about the manufacturing country of my old one, but it is of MUCH better quality than this Chinese piece of junk. Thinner metal, undersized spring (in the wrong place), generally built to sell, not to last. The product writeup is quite misleading. This is not, in any way, heavy duty. I suppose I thought that, since the company is in South Dakota, it would be of good quality. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Sue T

customer_reviews.title: When is it works well and is Hefty
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this product and design. I've used it now many times already considering that the weather has been cold here. It works well and is terribly built. I am concerned that the spring on the product seems to be smaller than necessary we'll see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: Demosthenes

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective - REDNECK!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the overall function and build, but would like to see a stainless steel spring which may hold up better in the weather and heat. I liked the first one, so I ordered two more for others.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: One small, but important flaw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace one that I had for years but finally broke. This one is made of much flimsier metal. I don't expect it to last long. Actually, most of it seems very sturdy but the grabbing mechanism was very thin and bent easily. Not sure why they designed in such an obvious weak link.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works well,
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a few times. Sure is handy and more sturdy than finding a branch! You do have to open the grabber, rather than it being spring loaded....but if it means one less moving part to break....that’s okay with me.
customer_reviews.author: Pk

customer_reviews.title: 😞
customer_reviews.text: These fo the job but they are not durable. The grabber arm was bent and twisted after picking up the first log
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lingerfelt

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby loves it. He had been complaining for some time that he needed a more efficient tool than just some burnt up old stick for rearranging logs and stoking the fire at our campsite. This does the trick and makes him feel like the master of fire that he thinks he is. The handle can be a bit awkward if you have small hands, but for a big strong man it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel S.

customer_reviews.title: So easy to handle even big logs.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my indoor, regular fireplace. It has replaced the various sets of log tongs I've had over the years. The unique one-handed design makes old tongs obsolete, and is much easier for a lady of 70 to manage. I hope it lasts for many years; but when it finally does wear out I'll definitely purchase another. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara  Austin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought the higher priced one and its still very poorly made. Very disappointed. I purchased one a few years back from a different manufacturer for less money and that was awesome. this one is very weak can't even pick up a log.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Collins

customer_reviews.title: This is great! I should buy another as a backup!
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty. Easy to use. Picks up heavy logs. I am really happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: S Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Horrible implementation. Needs to be more durable.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. Horrible implementation. I've used it for Three Fires now and the single claw has already bent. It just seems like they need to make it more durable. I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jediah B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product so much that I bought another for our camp trailer!
customer_reviews.author: jodey

customer_reviews.title: Piece of S—-t
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this piece of junk the handle broke off the first time we used it...could not return it because it was after the date.. don’t buy this unless you want to buy a new one every time you use this! One star is to much for this item would not let me choose zero
customer_reviews.author: As

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually going to send this item back it is not sturdy at all! It advertised that it can pick up small logs in a fire and just looking at it there is no way that's true! Now I'm scared to even buy another from you because the way it was advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Burrell

customer_reviews.title: Movable claw portion bends easily
customer_reviews.text: The grabber worked great the first time I used it, but the 3rd movable claw section is significantly bent to one side. I will try to bend it back, but it continued to get worse with the heat of the fire. Otherwise it worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Like the overall quality at a reasonable price. Cant give it a 5 star on durability as I have only used it twice. Handles decent sized logs and limbs , saves me from having to bend my old knees and back when I'm picking up and burning.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Fortin

customer_reviews.title: But it!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband fell in love with this instantly. He used it for hours one night to keep the fire going for our get together. Awesome product for an awesome price!
customer_reviews.author: melissa ybarra

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Friend had these! Had to have these for the fire pit! Very heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: Donnarea

customer_reviews.title: Broken in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Does not completely close around smaller logs so they slip through. Doesn’t handle larger logs due to light weight construction. One of the prongs broke in less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is cheap cheap cheaply made, found a comparable one at menards with about three times the sturdiness. Terrible purchase I’m sure it won’t last a season of camping
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It's perfect for picking up almost any size log
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep one for home and one for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this to stay in my camper for campfires. ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to stay in my camper for campfires. Have used it a number of times and it works perfectly, allowing me to move logs around in the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Drexell A George

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: We camp every weekend in the summer and this log grabber is used constantly. It is awesome. Very durable and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Susan T

customer_reviews.title: I used for camp fires
customer_reviews.text: A great product for rearranging logs in the camp fire
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Works great I have only used it 1 weekend but it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great I have only used it 1 weekend but it worked exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Daleo

customer_reviews.title: ... to hot and not to cold and light weight love
customer_reviews.text: It's not to hot and not to cold and light weight love it
customer_reviews.author: Pauly D

customer_reviews.title: gifts
customer_reviews.text: This will be a Christmas present. I bought for both son-in-laws
customer_reviews.author: Indiana Hearing Aid Co

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad, but a little flimsy. The moving arm is a thin piece of sheet metal, while the fixed arms are rods. If all we're rods, it would be much better. Also, the spring is a little loose, so it doesn't squeeze enough to get a grip on heavy logs. That said, it works really well, and makes moving logs in the fire easy when holding an icy refreshing beverage or some hot cocoa.
customer_reviews.author: David Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Picks up heavy items
customer_reviews.text: I have a disc problem but I still like to work in my shop. If I drop a board or tool this pick up tool is robust enough to pick it up. Some of the flimsy plastic ones cost just as much and can't lift more than a few ounces. This one is not for small items, it is built for firewood but many other uses will be found.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A. Bower

customer_reviews.title: Jaws not close tight enough
customer_reviews.text: The jaws do not close down enough to pick up or move a smaller diameter piece of wood __Say a 1 1/2" dia branch. I use this in a very small backyard fire pit and only burn small diameter wood. 1 1/2" to 3" is what I use! I'm using a washing machine tub fire pit so have to reach down into it to tend the fire! Please make this more flexible for us guys
customer_reviews.author: Ben  clemens

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty? The moving prong can easily be bent, mine was in the packaging. Luckily my 5 year old straightened it out for me. If you build fires with wood the size of spaghetti noodles, this “might” do the trick. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as an alternative to the $75 model you can buy at the camping store. I thought it wouldn't be as "sturdy" as the store bought models I've seen but I was wrong. This works perfectly for adjusting logs in both the fire pit outside and our indoor fireplace as well. No more struggling with the fire poker stick and throwing hot logs around!
customer_reviews.author: s_bates

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better made one.
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to pick up a log. The grabber doesn’t close enough to grab onto a split log. It’s a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, Poorly built, zero quality checks
customer_reviews.text: Great Idea, Poorly built, zero quality checks. Sending this one back for replacement, hope it actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Spamhater007

customer_reviews.title: You will love it!
customer_reviews.text: My camping buddies have this log grabber and they all love it. I was so envious that I bought my own!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I can see this thing lasting through about 3 or 4 fires before it falls apart.
customer_reviews.author: Cliffwalker

customer_reviews.title: Know what you’re buying....
customer_reviews.text: Pretty poorly constructed and poor materials used. Usually cannot lift up fire logs very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This log grabber is GREAT! It is heavy duty, yet easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Redneck Convent Heavy-Duty Log Grabber Fire Tongs Poker Tool with Spring Handle and 3 Prong, 36in – Place Wood on Campfire Fireplace
feature_bullets: ONE-HAND OPERATION: The Redneck Convent Heavy-Duty Log Grabber Fire Tongs Poker Tool with Spring Handle and 3 Prong, 36” Inch – Place Wood on Campfire Fireplace allows you to keep your hands 36 inches (91.4cm) away from the fire while turning firewood logs; Spring lever action handle opens on its own when you release tension on the lever so you do not have to pull it apart with both hands; Simply grab logs and adjust them with one hand

KEEP HANDS SAFE: 36-inch / 3-foot (31.4cm / 0.9m) overall length; 4.5-inch long x 1-inch diameter (11.4cm x 2.5cm) rubber grip handle stays cool to the touch for safety and ultimate comfort; Do not risk getting burned at your next outdoor gathering around the fire pit and use this grabber to keep away from the flames while still moving logs and controlling the flames

GRAB LARGE LOGS: Picks up logs up to 5 inches (12.7cm) in diameter; Grabber hooks have 5-inch (12.7) inside diameter (ID) when opened wide; 7-inch (17.8cm) long curved grabber hooks for moving logs to fire pit and turning logs in fire
BUILT TO LAST: All steel construction with black powder coat finish for added strength and longevity when used both indoors and outdoors; Use for campfire pits, smokers, or fireplaces

SECURE GRIP: Grabber includes 3 tongs – 1 on the right, 1 on the left, and 1 on the opposite side that moves into the center between left and right tongs when spring lever is pressed so you have a sure grip and ultimate control

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars110 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Warranty Description: This product has a manufacturer warranty against defects in materials and workmanship for a period of one
